00021 /*
00022 *********************************************************************************************************
00023 *                              MAPPING TABLE TO MAP BIT POSITION TO BIT MASK
00024 *
00025 * Note: Index into table is desired bit position, 0..7
00026 *       Indexed value corresponds to bit mask
00027 *********************************************************************************************************
00028 */
00029 
00030 INT8U  const  OSMapTbl[8]   = {0x01, 0x02, 0x04, 0x08, 0x10, 0x20, 0x40, 0x80};
00031 
00032 /*
00033 *********************************************************************************************************
00034 *                                       PRIORITY RESOLUTION TABLE
00035 *
00036 * Note: Index into table is bit pattern to resolve highest priority
00037 *       Indexed value corresponds to highest priority bit position (i.e. 0..7)
00038 *********************************************************************************************************
00039 */
00040 
00041 INT8U  const  OSUnMapTbl[256] = {
00042     0, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0x00 to 0x0F                             */
00043     4, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0x10 to 0x1F                             */
00044     5, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0x20 to 0x2F                             */
00045     4, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0x30 to 0x3F                             */
00046     6, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0x40 to 0x4F                             */
00047     4, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0x50 to 0x5F                             */
00048     5, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0x60 to 0x6F                             */
00049     4, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0x70 to 0x7F                             */
00050     7, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0x80 to 0x8F                             */
00051     4, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0x90 to 0x9F                             */
00052     5, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0xA0 to 0xAF                             */
00053     4, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0xB0 to 0xBF                             */
00054     6, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0xC0 to 0xCF                             */
00055     4, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0xD0 to 0xDF                             */
00056     5, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0,       /* 0xE0 to 0xEF                             */
00057     4, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0        /* 0xF0 to 0xFF                             */
00058 };

00076 /*
00077 *********************************************************************************************************
00078 *                         GET THE NAME OF A SEMAPHORE, MUTEX, MAILBOX or QUEUE
00079 *
00080 * Description: This function is used to obtain the name assigned to a semaphore, mutex, mailbox or queue.
00081 *
00082 * Arguments  : pevent    is a pointer to the event group.  'pevent' can point either to a semaphore,
00083 *                        a mutex, a mailbox or a queue.  Where this function is concerned, the actual
00084 *                        type is irrelevant.
00085 *
00086 *              pname     is a pointer to an ASCII string that will receive the name of the semaphore,
00087 *                        mutex, mailbox or queue.  The string must be able to hold at least 
00088 *                        OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE characters.
00089 *
00090 *              err       is a pointer to an error code that can contain one of the following values:
00091 *
00092 *                        OS_NO_ERR                  if the name was copied to 'pname'
00093 *                        OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE          if 'pevent' is not pointing to the proper event 
00094 *                                                   control block type.
00095 *                        OS_ERR_PNAME_NULL          You passed a NULL pointer for 'pname'
00096 *                        OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL         if you passed a NULL pointer for 'pevent'
00097 *
00098 * Returns    : The length of the string or 0 if the 'pevent' is a NULL pointer.
00099 *********************************************************************************************************
00100 */
00101 
00102 #if OS_EVENT_EN && (OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE > 1)
00103 INT8U  OSEventNameGet (OS_EVENT *pevent, char *pname, INT8U *err)
00104 {
00105     INT8U      len;
00106 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00107     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00108 #endif    
00109 
00110 
00111 
00112 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00113     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                     /* Validate 'err'                                     */
00114         return (0);
00115     }
00116     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {               /* Is 'pevent' a NULL pointer?                        */
00117         *err = OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL;
00118         return (0);
00119     }
00120     if (pname == (char *)0) {                    /* Is 'pname' a NULL pointer?                         */
00121         *err = OS_ERR_PNAME_NULL;
00122         return (0);
00123     }
00124 #endif
00125     switch (pevent->OSEventType) {
00126         case OS_EVENT_TYPE_SEM:
00127         case OS_EVENT_TYPE_MUTEX:
00128         case OS_EVENT_TYPE_MBOX:
00129         case OS_EVENT_TYPE_Q:
00130              break;
00131 
00132         default:
00133              *err = OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE;
00134              return (0);
00135     }
00136     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00137     len  = OS_StrCopy(pname, pevent->OSEventName);    /* Copy name from OS_EVENT                       */
00138     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00139     *err = OS_NO_ERR;
00140     return (len);
00141 }
00142 #endif
00143 
00144 /*$PAGE*/
00145 /*
00146 *********************************************************************************************************
00147 *                         ASSIGN A NAME TO A SEMAPHORE, MUTEX, MAILBOX or QUEUE
00148 *
00149 * Description: This function assigns a name to a semaphore, mutex, mailbox or queue.
00150 *
00151 * Arguments  : pevent    is a pointer to the event group.  'pevent' can point either to a semaphore,
00152 *                        a mutex, a mailbox or a queue.  Where this function is concerned, it doesn't
00153 *                        matter the actual type.
00154 *
00155 *              pname     is a pointer to an ASCII string that will be used as the name of the semaphore,
00156 *                        mutex, mailbox or queue.  The string must be able to hold at least 
00157 *                        OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE characters.
00158 *
00159 *              err       is a pointer to an error code that can contain one of the following values:
00160 *
00161 *                        OS_NO_ERR                  if the requested task is resumed
00162 *                        OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE          if 'pevent' is not pointing to the proper event 
00163 *                                                   control block type.
00164 *                        OS_ERR_PNAME_NULL          You passed a NULL pointer for 'pname'
00165 *                        OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL         if you passed a NULL pointer for 'pevent'
00166 *
00167 * Returns    : None
00168 *********************************************************************************************************
00169 */
00170 
00171 #if OS_EVENT_EN && (OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE > 1)
00172 void  OSEventNameSet (OS_EVENT *pevent, char *pname, INT8U *err)
00173 {
00174     INT8U      len;
00175 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00176     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00177 #endif    
00178 
00179 
00180 
00181 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00182     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                     /* Validate 'err'                                     */
00183         return;
00184     }
00185     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {               /* Is 'pevent' a NULL pointer?                        */
00186         *err = OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL;
00187         return;
00188     }
00189     if (pname == (char *)0) {                    /* Is 'pname' a NULL pointer?                         */
00190         *err = OS_ERR_PNAME_NULL;
00191         return;
00192     }
00193 #endif
00194     switch (pevent->OSEventType) {
00195         case OS_EVENT_TYPE_SEM:
00196         case OS_EVENT_TYPE_MUTEX:
00197         case OS_EVENT_TYPE_MBOX:
00198         case OS_EVENT_TYPE_Q:
00199              break;
00200 
00201         default:
00202              *err = OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE;
00203              return;
00204     }
00205     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00206     len = OS_StrLen(pname);                           /* Can we fit the string in the storage area?    */
00207     if (len > (OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE - 1)) {             /* No                                            */
00208         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00209         *err = OS_ERR_EVENT_NAME_TOO_LONG;
00210         return;
00211     } 
00212     (void)OS_StrCopy(pevent->OSEventName, pname);     /* Yes, copy name to the event control block     */
00213     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00214     *err = OS_NO_ERR;
00215 }
00216 #endif

00219 /*
00220 *********************************************************************************************************
00221 *                                             INITIALIZATION
00222 *
00223 * Description: This function is used to initialize the internals of uC/OS-II and MUST be called prior to
00224 *              creating any uC/OS-II object and, prior to calling OSStart().
00225 *
00226 * Arguments  : none
00227 *
00228 * Returns    : none
00229 *********************************************************************************************************
00230 */
00231 
00232 void  OSInit (void)
00233 {
00234 #if OS_VERSION >= 204
00235     OSInitHookBegin();                                           /* Call port specific initialization code   */
00236 #endif
00237 
00238     OS_InitMisc();                                               /* Initialize miscellaneous variables       */
00239 
00240     OS_InitRdyList();                                            /* Initialize the Ready List                */
00241 
00242     OS_InitTCBList();                                            /* Initialize the free list of OS_TCBs      */
00243 
00244     OS_InitEventList();                                          /* Initialize the free list of OS_EVENTs    */
00245 
00246 #if (OS_VERSION >= 251) && (OS_FLAG_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_FLAGS > 0)
00247     OS_FlagInit();                                               /* Initialize the event flag structures     */
00248 #endif
00249 
00250 #if (OS_MEM_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_MEM_PART > 0)
00251     OS_MemInit();                                                /* Initialize the memory manager            */
00252 #endif
00253 
00254 #if (OS_Q_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_QS > 0)
00255     OS_QInit();                                                  /* Initialize the message queue structures  */
00256 #endif
00257 
00258     OS_InitTaskIdle();                                           /* Create the Idle Task                     */
00259 #if OS_TASK_STAT_EN > 0
00260     OS_InitTaskStat();                                           /* Create the Statistic Task                */
00261 #endif
00262 
00263 #if OS_VERSION >= 204
00264     OSInitHookEnd();                                             /* Call port specific init. code            */
00265 #endif
00266 
00267 #if OS_VERSION >= 270 && OS_DEBUG_EN > 0
00268     OSDebugInit();
00269 #endif
00270 }
00271 /*$PAGE*/
00272 /*
00273 *********************************************************************************************************
00274 *                                              ENTER ISR
00275 *
00276 * Description: This function is used to notify uC/OS-II that you are about to service an interrupt
00277 *              service routine (ISR).  This allows uC/OS-II to keep track of interrupt nesting and thus
00278 *              only perform rescheduling at the last nested ISR.
00279 *
00280 * Arguments  : none
00281 *
00282 * Returns    : none
00283 *
00284 * Notes      : 1) This function should be called ith interrupts already disabled
00285 *              2) Your ISR can directly increment OSIntNesting without calling this function because
00286 *                 OSIntNesting has been declared 'global'.  
00287 *              3) You MUST still call OSIntExit() even though you increment OSIntNesting directly.
00288 *              4) You MUST invoke OSIntEnter() and OSIntExit() in pair.  In other words, for every call
00289 *                 to OSIntEnter() at the beginning of the ISR you MUST have a call to OSIntExit() at the
00290 *                 end of the ISR.
00291 *              5) You are allowed to nest interrupts up to 255 levels deep.
00292 *              6) I removed the OS_ENTER_CRITICAL() and OS_EXIT_CRITICAL() around the increment because
00293 *                 OSIntEnter() is always called with interrupts disabled.
00294 *********************************************************************************************************
00295 */
00296 
00297 void  OSIntEnter (void)
00298 {
00299     if (OSRunning == TRUE) {
00300         if (OSIntNesting < 255u) {
00301             OSIntNesting++;                      /* Increment ISR nesting level                        */
00302         }
00303     }
00304 }
00305 /*$PAGE*/
00306 /*
00307 *********************************************************************************************************
00308 *                                               EXIT ISR
00309 *
00310 * Description: This function is used to notify uC/OS-II that you have completed serviving an ISR.  When
00311 *              the last nested ISR has completed, uC/OS-II will call the scheduler to determine whether
00312 *              a new, high-priority task, is ready to run.
00313 *
00314 * Arguments  : none
00315 *
00316 * Returns    : none
00317 *
00318 * Notes      : 1) You MUST invoke OSIntEnter() and OSIntExit() in pair.  In other words, for every call
00319 *                 to OSIntEnter() at the beginning of the ISR you MUST have a call to OSIntExit() at the
00320 *                 end of the ISR.
00321 *              2) Rescheduling is prevented when the scheduler is locked (see OS_SchedLock())
00322 *********************************************************************************************************
00323 */
00324 
00325 void  OSIntExit (void)
00326 {
00327     INT8U      y;
00328 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                                /* Allocate storage for CPU status register */
00329     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00330 #endif    
00331 
00332 
00333 
00334     if (OSRunning == TRUE) {
00335         OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00336         if (OSIntNesting > 0) {                            /* Prevent OSIntNesting from wrapping       */
00337             OSIntNesting--;
00338         }
00339         if (OSIntNesting == 0) {                           /* Reschedule only if all ISRs complete ... */
00340             if (OSLockNesting == 0) {                      /* ... and not locked.                      */
00341                 y             = OSUnMapTbl[OSRdyGrp];          
00342                 OSPrioHighRdy = (INT8U)((y << 3) + OSUnMapTbl[OSRdyTbl[y]]);
00343                 if (OSPrioHighRdy != OSPrioCur) {          /* No Ctx Sw if current task is highest rdy */
00344                     OSTCBHighRdy  = OSTCBPrioTbl[OSPrioHighRdy];
00345 #if OS_TASK_PROFILE_EN > 0
00346                     OSTCBHighRdy->OSTCBCtxSwCtr++;         /* Inc. # of context switches to this task  */
00347 #endif
00348                     OSCtxSwCtr++;                          /* Keep track of the number of ctx switches */
00349                     OSIntCtxSw();                          /* Perform interrupt level ctx switch       */
00350                 }
00351             }
00352         }
00353         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00354     }
00355 }
00356 /*$PAGE*/
00357 /*
00358 *********************************************************************************************************
00359 *                                          PREVENT SCHEDULING
00360 *
00361 * Description: This function is used to prevent rescheduling to take place.  This allows your application
00362 *              to prevent context switches until you are ready to permit context switching.
00363 *
00364 * Arguments  : none
00365 *
00366 * Returns    : none
00367 *
00368 * Notes      : 1) You MUST invoke OSSchedLock() and OSSchedUnlock() in pair.  In other words, for every
00369 *                 call to OSSchedLock() you MUST have a call to OSSchedUnlock().
00370 *********************************************************************************************************
00371 */
00372 
00373 #if OS_SCHED_LOCK_EN > 0
00374 void  OSSchedLock (void)
00375 {
00376 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00377     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00378 #endif    
00379 
00380 
00381 
00382     if (OSRunning == TRUE) {                     /* Make sure multitasking is running                  */
00383         OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00384         if (OSLockNesting < 255u) {              /* Prevent OSLockNesting from wrapping back to 0      */
00385             OSLockNesting++;                     /* Increment lock nesting level                       */
00386         }
00387         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00388     }
00389 }
00390 #endif    
00391 
00392 /*$PAGE*/
00393 /*
00394 *********************************************************************************************************
00395 *                                          ENABLE SCHEDULING
00396 *
00397 * Description: This function is used to re-allow rescheduling.
00398 *
00399 * Arguments  : none
00400 *
00401 * Returns    : none
00402 *
00403 * Notes      : 1) You MUST invoke OSSchedLock() and OSSchedUnlock() in pair.  In other words, for every
00404 *                 call to OSSchedLock() you MUST have a call to OSSchedUnlock().
00405 *********************************************************************************************************
00406 */
00407 
00408 #if OS_SCHED_LOCK_EN > 0
00409 void  OSSchedUnlock (void)
00410 {
00411 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                                /* Allocate storage for CPU status register */
00412     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00413 #endif    
00414 
00415 
00416 
00417     if (OSRunning == TRUE) {                               /* Make sure multitasking is running        */
00418         OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00419         if (OSLockNesting > 0) {                           /* Do not decrement if already 0            */
00420             OSLockNesting--;                               /* Decrement lock nesting level             */
00421             if (OSLockNesting == 0) {                      /* See if scheduler is enabled and ...      */
00422                 if (OSIntNesting == 0) {                   /* ... not in an ISR                        */
00423                     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00424                     OS_Sched();                            /* See if a HPT is ready                    */
00425                 } else {
00426                     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00427                 }
00428             } else {
00429                 OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00430             }
00431         } else {
00432             OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00433         }
00434     }
00435 }
00436 #endif    
00437 
00438 /*$PAGE*/
00439 /*
00440 *********************************************************************************************************
00441 *                                          START MULTITASKING
00442 *
00443 * Description: This function is used to start the multitasking process which lets uC/OS-II manages the
00444 *              task that you have created.  Before you can call OSStart(), you MUST have called OSInit()
00445 *              and you MUST have created at least one task.
00446 *
00447 * Arguments  : none
00448 *
00449 * Returns    : none
00450 *
00451 * Note       : OSStartHighRdy() MUST:
00452 *                 a) Call OSTaskSwHook() then,
00453 *                 b) Set OSRunning to TRUE.
00454 *                 c) Load the context of the task pointed to by OSTCBHighRdy.
00455 *                 d_ Execute the task.
00456 *********************************************************************************************************
00457 */
00458 
00459 void  OSStart (void)
00460 {
00461     INT8U y;
00462     INT8U x;
00463 
00464 
00465     if (OSRunning == FALSE) {
00466         y             = OSUnMapTbl[OSRdyGrp];        /* Find highest priority's task priority number   */
00467         x             = OSUnMapTbl[OSRdyTbl[y]];
00468         OSPrioHighRdy = (INT8U)((y << 3) + x);
00469         OSPrioCur     = OSPrioHighRdy;
00470         OSTCBHighRdy  = OSTCBPrioTbl[OSPrioHighRdy]; /* Point to highest priority task ready to run    */
00471         OSTCBCur      = OSTCBHighRdy;
00472         OSStartHighRdy();                            /* Execute target specific code to start task     */
00473     }
00474 }
00475 /*$PAGE*/
00476 /*
00477 *********************************************************************************************************
00478 *                                        STATISTICS INITIALIZATION
00479 *
00480 * Description: This function is called by your application to establish CPU usage by first determining
00481 *              how high a 32-bit counter would count to in 1 second if no other tasks were to execute
00482 *              during that time.  CPU usage is then determined by a low priority task which keeps track
00483 *              of this 32-bit counter every second but this time, with other tasks running.  CPU usage is
00484 *              determined by:
00485 *
00486 *                                             OSIdleCtr
00487 *                 CPU Usage (%) = 100 * (1 - ------------)
00488 *                                            OSIdleCtrMax
00489 *
00490 * Arguments  : none
00491 *
00492 * Returns    : none
00493 *********************************************************************************************************
00494 */
00495 
00496 #if OS_TASK_STAT_EN > 0
00497 void  OSStatInit (void)
00498 {
00499 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00500     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00501 #endif    
00502 
00503 
00504 
00505     OSTimeDly(2);                                /* Synchronize with clock tick                        */
00506     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00507     OSIdleCtr    = 0L;                           /* Clear idle counter                                 */
00508     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00509     OSTimeDly(OS_TICKS_PER_SEC / 10);            /* Determine MAX. idle counter value for 1/10 second  */
00510     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00511     OSIdleCtrMax = OSIdleCtr;                    /* Store maximum idle counter count in 1/10 second    */
00512     OSStatRdy    = TRUE;
00513     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00514 }
00515 #endif
00516 /*$PAGE*/
00517 /*
00518 *********************************************************************************************************
00519 *                                         PROCESS SYSTEM TICK
00520 *
00521 * Description: This function is used to signal to uC/OS-II the occurrence of a 'system tick' (also known
00522 *              as a 'clock tick').  This function should be called by the ticker ISR but, can also be
00523 *              called by a high priority task.
00524 *
00525 * Arguments  : none
00526 *
00527 * Returns    : none
00528 *********************************************************************************************************
00529 */
00530 
00531 void  OSTimeTick (void)
00532 {
00533     OS_TCB    *ptcb;
00534 #if OS_TICK_STEP_EN > 0
00535     BOOLEAN    step;
00536 #endif
00537 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                                /* Allocate storage for CPU status register     */
00538     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00539 #endif
00540 
00541 
00542 
00543 #if OS_TIME_TICK_HOOK_EN > 0
00544     OSTimeTickHook();                                      /* Call user definable hook                     */
00545 #endif
00546 #if OS_TIME_GET_SET_EN > 0
00547     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();                                   /* Update the 32-bit tick counter               */
00548     OSTime++;
00549     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00550 #endif
00551     if (OSRunning == TRUE) {
00552 #if OS_TICK_STEP_EN > 0
00553         switch (OSTickStepState) {                         /* Determine whether we need to process a tick  */
00554             case OS_TICK_STEP_DIS:                         /* Yes, stepping is disabled                    */
00555                  step = TRUE;
00556                  break;
00557 
00558             case OS_TICK_STEP_WAIT:                        /* No,  waiting for uC/OS-View to set ...       */
00559                  step = FALSE;                             /*      .. OSTickStepState to OS_TICK_STEP_ONCE */
00560                  break;
00561 
00562             case OS_TICK_STEP_ONCE:                        /* Yes, process tick once and wait for next ... */
00563                  step            = TRUE;                   /*      ... step command from uC/OS-View        */
00564                  OSTickStepState = OS_TICK_STEP_WAIT;
00565                  break;
00566 
00567             default:                                       /* Invalid case, correct situation              */
00568                  step            = TRUE;
00569                  OSTickStepState = OS_TICK_STEP_DIS;
00570                  break;
00571         }
00572         if (step == FALSE) {                               /* Return if waiting for step command           */
00573             return;
00574         }
00575 #endif
00576         ptcb = OSTCBList;                                  /* Point at first TCB in TCB list               */
00577         while (ptcb->OSTCBPrio != OS_IDLE_PRIO) {          /* Go through all TCBs in TCB list              */
00578             OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00579             if (ptcb->OSTCBDly != 0) {                     /* No, Delayed or waiting for event with TO     */
00580                 if (--ptcb->OSTCBDly == 0) {               /* Decrement nbr of ticks to end of delay       */
00581                                                            /* Check for timeout                            */
00582                     if ((ptcb->OSTCBStat & OS_STAT_PEND_ANY) != OS_STAT_RDY) {
00583                         ptcb->OSTCBStat   &= ~OS_STAT_PEND_ANY;                /* Yes, Clear status flag   */
00584                         ptcb->OSTCBPendTO  = TRUE;                             /* Indicate PEND timeout    */
00585                     } else {
00586                         ptcb->OSTCBPendTO  = FALSE;
00587                     }
00588 
00589                     if ((ptcb->OSTCBStat & OS_STAT_SUSPEND) == OS_STAT_RDY) {  /* Is task suspended?       */
00590                         OSRdyGrp               |= ptcb->OSTCBBitY;             /* No,  Make ready          */
00591                         OSRdyTbl[ptcb->OSTCBY] |= ptcb->OSTCBBitX;
00592                     }
00593                 }
00594             }
00595             ptcb = ptcb->OSTCBNext;                        /* Point at next TCB in TCB list                */
00596             OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00597         }
00598     }
00599 }
00600 /*$PAGE*/
00601 /*
00602 *********************************************************************************************************
00603 *                                             GET VERSION
00604 *
00605 * Description: This function is used to return the version number of uC/OS-II.  The returned value
00606 *              corresponds to uC/OS-II's version number multiplied by 100.  In other words, version 2.00
00607 *              would be returned as 200.
00608 *
00609 * Arguments  : none
00610 *
00611 * Returns    : the version number of uC/OS-II multiplied by 100.
00612 *********************************************************************************************************
00613 */
00614 
00615 INT16U  OSVersion (void)
00616 {
00617     return (OS_VERSION);
00618 }
00619 
00620 /*$PAGE*/
00621 /*
00622 *********************************************************************************************************
00623 *                                            DUMMY FUNCTION
00624 *
00625 * Description: This function doesn't do anything.  It is called by OSTaskDel().
00626 *
00627 * Arguments  : none
00628 *
00629 * Returns    : none
00630 *********************************************************************************************************
00631 */
00632 
00633 #if OS_TASK_DEL_EN > 0
00634 void  OS_Dummy (void)
00635 {
00636 }
00637 #endif
00638 
00639 /*$PAGE*/
00640 /*
00641 *********************************************************************************************************
00642 *                             MAKE TASK READY TO RUN BASED ON EVENT OCCURING
00643 *
00644 * Description: This function is called by other uC/OS-II services and is used to ready a task that was
00645 *              waiting for an event to occur.
00646 *
00647 * Arguments  : pevent    is a pointer to the event control block corresponding to the event.
00648 *
00649 *              msg       is a pointer to a message.  This pointer is used by message oriented services
00650 *                        such as MAILBOXEs and QUEUEs.  The pointer is not used when called by other
00651 *                        service functions.
00652 *
00653 *              msk       is a mask that is used to clear the status byte of the TCB.  For example,
00654 *                        OSSemPost() will pass OS_STAT_SEM, OSMboxPost() will pass OS_STAT_MBOX etc.
00655 *
00656 * Returns    : none
00657 *
00658 * Note       : This function is INTERNAL to uC/OS-II and your application should not call it.
00659 *********************************************************************************************************
00660 */
00661 #if OS_EVENT_EN
00662 INT8U  OS_EventTaskRdy (OS_EVENT *pevent, void *msg, INT8U msk)
00663 {
00664     OS_TCB *ptcb;
00665     INT8U   x;
00666     INT8U   y;
00667     INT8U   bitx;
00668     INT8U   bity;
00669     INT8U   prio;
00670 
00671 
00672     y                      = OSUnMapTbl[pevent->OSEventGrp];   /* Find HPT waiting for message         */
00673     bity                   = OSMapTbl[y];
00674     x                      = OSUnMapTbl[pevent->OSEventTbl[y]];
00675     bitx                   = OSMapTbl[x];
00676     prio                   = (INT8U)((y << 3) + x);     /* Find priority of task getting the msg       */
00677     pevent->OSEventTbl[y] &= ~bitx;                     /* Remove this task from the waiting list      */
00678     if (pevent->OSEventTbl[y] == 0x00) {                
00679         pevent->OSEventGrp &= ~bity;                    /* Clr group bit if this was only task pending */
00680     }
00681     ptcb                 =  OSTCBPrioTbl[prio];         /* Point to this task's OS_TCB                 */
00682     ptcb->OSTCBDly       =  0;                          /* Prevent OSTimeTick() from readying task     */
00683     ptcb->OSTCBEventPtr  = (OS_EVENT *)0;               /* Unlink ECB from this task                   */
00684 #if ((OS_Q_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_QS > 0)) || (OS_MBOX_EN > 0)
00685     ptcb->OSTCBMsg       = msg;                         /* Send message directly to waiting task       */
00686 #else
00687     msg                  = msg;                         /* Prevent compiler warning if not used        */
00688 #endif
00689     ptcb->OSTCBPendTO    = FALSE;                       /* Cancel 'any' timeout because of post        */
00690     ptcb->OSTCBStat     &= ~msk;                        /* Clear bit associated with event type        */
00691     if (ptcb->OSTCBStat == OS_STAT_RDY) {               /* See if task is ready (could be susp'd)      */
00692         OSRdyGrp        |=  bity;                       /* Put task in the ready to run list           */
00693         OSRdyTbl[y]     |=  bitx;
00694     }
00695     return (prio);
00696 }
00697 #endif
00698 /*$PAGE*/
00699 /*
00700 *********************************************************************************************************
00701 *                                   MAKE TASK WAIT FOR EVENT TO OCCUR
00702 *
00703 * Description: This function is called by other uC/OS-II services to suspend a task because an event has
00704 *              not occurred.
00705 *
00706 * Arguments  : pevent   is a pointer to the event control block for which the task will be waiting for.
00707 *
00708 * Returns    : none
00709 *
00710 * Note       : This function is INTERNAL to uC/OS-II and your application should not call it.
00711 *********************************************************************************************************
00712 */
00713 #if OS_EVENT_EN
00714 void  OS_EventTaskWait (OS_EVENT *pevent)
00715 {
00716     INT8U  y;
00717 
00718 
00719     OSTCBCur->OSTCBEventPtr = pevent;             /* Store pointer to event control block in TCB       */
00720     y                       = OSTCBCur->OSTCBY;   /* Task no longer ready                              */
00721     OSRdyTbl[y]            &= ~OSTCBCur->OSTCBBitX;
00722     if (OSRdyTbl[y] == 0x00) {                   
00723         OSRdyGrp &= ~OSTCBCur->OSTCBBitY;         /* Clear event grp bit if this was only task pending */
00724     }
00725     pevent->OSEventTbl[OSTCBCur->OSTCBY] |= OSTCBCur->OSTCBBitX;          /* Put task in waiting list  */
00726     pevent->OSEventGrp                   |= OSTCBCur->OSTCBBitY;
00727 }
00728 #endif
00729 /*$PAGE*/
00730 /*
00731 *********************************************************************************************************
00732 *                              MAKE TASK READY TO RUN BASED ON EVENT TIMEOUT
00733 *
00734 * Description: This function is called by other uC/OS-II services to make a task ready to run because a
00735 *              timeout occurred.
00736 *
00737 * Arguments  : pevent   is a pointer to the event control block which is readying a task.
00738 *
00739 * Returns    : none
00740 *
00741 * Note       : This function is INTERNAL to uC/OS-II and your application should not call it.
00742 *********************************************************************************************************
00743 */
00744 #if OS_EVENT_EN
00745 void  OS_EventTO (OS_EVENT *pevent)
00746 {
00747     INT8U  y;
00748 
00749 
00750     y                      = OSTCBCur->OSTCBY;
00751     pevent->OSEventTbl[y] &= ~OSTCBCur->OSTCBBitX;     /* Remove task from wait list                   */
00752     if (pevent->OSEventTbl[y] == 0x00) {
00753         pevent->OSEventGrp &= ~OSTCBCur->OSTCBBitY;
00754     }
00755     OSTCBCur->OSTCBPendTO   = FALSE;                   /* Clear the Pend Timeout flag                  */
00756     OSTCBCur->OSTCBStat     = OS_STAT_RDY;             /* Set status to ready                          */
00757     OSTCBCur->OSTCBEventPtr = (OS_EVENT *)0;           /* No longer waiting for event                  */
00758 }
00759 #endif
00760 /*$PAGE*/
00761 /*
00762 *********************************************************************************************************
00763 *                                 INITIALIZE EVENT CONTROL BLOCK'S WAIT LIST
00764 *
00765 * Description: This function is called by other uC/OS-II services to initialize the event wait list.
00766 *
00767 * Arguments  : pevent    is a pointer to the event control block allocated to the event.
00768 *
00769 * Returns    : none
00770 *
00771 * Note       : This function is INTERNAL to uC/OS-II and your application should not call it.
00772 *********************************************************************************************************
00773 */
00774 #if OS_EVENT_EN
00775 void  OS_EventWaitListInit (OS_EVENT *pevent)
00776 {
00777     INT8U  *ptbl;
00778 
00779 
00780     pevent->OSEventGrp = 0x00;                   /* No task waiting on event                           */
00781     ptbl               = &pevent->OSEventTbl[0];
00782 
00783 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 0
00784     *ptbl++            = 0x00;
00785 #endif
00786 
00787 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 1
00788     *ptbl++            = 0x00;
00789 #endif
00790 
00791 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 2
00792     *ptbl++            = 0x00;
00793 #endif
00794 
00795 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 3
00796     *ptbl++            = 0x00;
00797 #endif
00798 
00799 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 4
00800     *ptbl++            = 0x00;
00801 #endif
00802 
00803 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 5
00804     *ptbl++            = 0x00;
00805 #endif
00806 
00807 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 6
00808     *ptbl++            = 0x00;
00809 #endif
00810 
00811 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 7
00812     *ptbl              = 0x00;
00813 #endif
00814 }
00815 #endif
00816 /*$PAGE*/
00817 /*
00818 *********************************************************************************************************
00819 *                                             INITIALIZATION
00820 *                           INITIALIZE THE FREE LIST OF EVENT CONTROL BLOCKS
00821 *
00822 * Description: This function is called by OSInit() to initialize the free list of event control blocks.
00823 *
00824 * Arguments  : none
00825 *
00826 * Returns    : none
00827 *********************************************************************************************************
00828 */
00829 
00830 static  void  OS_InitEventList (void)
00831 {
00832 #if OS_EVENT_EN && (OS_MAX_EVENTS > 0)
00833 #if (OS_MAX_EVENTS > 1)
00834     INT16U     i;
00835     OS_EVENT  *pevent1;
00836     OS_EVENT  *pevent2;
00837 
00838 
00839     OS_MemClr((INT8U *)&OSEventTbl[0], sizeof(OSEventTbl)); /* Clear the event table                   */
00840     pevent1 = &OSEventTbl[0];
00841     pevent2 = &OSEventTbl[1];
00842     for (i = 0; i < (OS_MAX_EVENTS - 1); i++) {             /* Init. list of free EVENT control blocks */
00843         pevent1->OSEventType    = OS_EVENT_TYPE_UNUSED;
00844         pevent1->OSEventPtr     = pevent2;
00845 #if OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE > 1
00846         pevent1->OSEventName[0] = '?';                      /* Unknown name                            */
00847         pevent1->OSEventName[1] = OS_ASCII_NUL;
00848 #endif
00849         pevent1++;
00850         pevent2++;
00851     }
00852     pevent1->OSEventType            = OS_EVENT_TYPE_UNUSED;
00853     pevent1->OSEventPtr             = (OS_EVENT *)0;
00854 #if OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE > 1
00855     pevent1->OSEventName[0]         = '?';                  
00856     pevent1->OSEventName[1]         = OS_ASCII_NUL;
00857 #endif
00858     OSEventFreeList                 = &OSEventTbl[0];
00859 #else
00860     OSEventFreeList                 = &OSEventTbl[0];       /* Only have ONE event control block       */
00861     OSEventFreeList->OSEventType    = OS_EVENT_TYPE_UNUSED;
00862     OSEventFreeList->OSEventPtr     = (OS_EVENT *)0;
00863 #if OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE > 1
00864     OSEventFreeList->OSEventName[0] = '?';                  /* Unknown name                            */
00865     OSEventFreeList->OSEventName[1] = OS_ASCII_NUL;
00866 #endif
00867 #endif
00868 #endif
00869 }
00870 /*$PAGE*/
00871 /*
00872 *********************************************************************************************************
00873 *                                             INITIALIZATION
00874 *                                    INITIALIZE MISCELLANEOUS VARIABLES
00875 *
00876 * Description: This function is called by OSInit() to initialize miscellaneous variables.
00877 *
00878 * Arguments  : none
00879 *
00880 * Returns    : none
00881 *********************************************************************************************************
00882 */
00883 
00884 static  void  OS_InitMisc (void)
00885 {
00886 #if OS_TIME_GET_SET_EN > 0   
00887     OSTime        = 0L;                                    /* Clear the 32-bit system clock            */
00888 #endif
00889 
00890     OSIntNesting  = 0;                                     /* Clear the interrupt nesting counter      */
00891     OSLockNesting = 0;                                     /* Clear the scheduling lock counter        */
00892 
00893     OSTaskCtr     = 0;                                     /* Clear the number of tasks                */
00894 
00895     OSRunning     = FALSE;                                 /* Indicate that multitasking not started   */
00896     
00897     OSCtxSwCtr    = 0;                                     /* Clear the context switch counter         */
00898     OSIdleCtr     = 0L;                                    /* Clear the 32-bit idle counter            */
00899 
00900 #if OS_TASK_STAT_EN > 0
00901     OSIdleCtrRun  = 0L;
00902     OSIdleCtrMax  = 0L;
00903     OSStatRdy     = FALSE;                                 /* Statistic task is not ready              */
00904 #endif
00905 }
00906 /*$PAGE*/
00907 /*
00908 *********************************************************************************************************
00909 *                                             INITIALIZATION
00910 *                                       INITIALIZE THE READY LIST
00911 *
00912 * Description: This function is called by OSInit() to initialize the Ready List.
00913 *
00914 * Arguments  : none
00915 *
00916 * Returns    : none
00917 *********************************************************************************************************
00918 */
00919 
00920 static  void  OS_InitRdyList (void)
00921 {
00922     INT8U    i;
00923     INT8U   *prdytbl;
00924 
00925 
00926     OSRdyGrp      = 0x00;                                  /* Clear the ready list                     */
00927     prdytbl       = &OSRdyTbl[0];
00928     for (i = 0; i < OS_RDY_TBL_SIZE; i++) {
00929         *prdytbl++ = 0x00;
00930     }
00931 
00932     OSPrioCur     = 0;
00933     OSPrioHighRdy = 0;
00934 
00935     OSTCBHighRdy  = (OS_TCB *)0;                                 
00936     OSTCBCur      = (OS_TCB *)0;
00937 }
00938 
00939 /*$PAGE*/
00940 /*
00941 *********************************************************************************************************
00942 *                                             INITIALIZATION
00943 *                                         CREATING THE IDLE TASK
00944 *
00945 * Description: This function creates the Idle Task.
00946 *
00947 * Arguments  : none
00948 *
00949 * Returns    : none
00950 *********************************************************************************************************
00951 */
00952 
00953 static  void  OS_InitTaskIdle (void)
00954 {
00955 #if OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE > 14                    
00956     INT8U  err;
00957 #endif
00958 
00959 
00960 #if OS_TASK_CREATE_EXT_EN > 0
00961     #if OS_STK_GROWTH == 1
00962     (void)OSTaskCreateExt(OS_TaskIdle,
00963                           (void *)0,                                 /* No arguments passed to OS_TaskIdle() */
00964                           &OSTaskIdleStk[OS_TASK_IDLE_STK_SIZE - 1], /* Set Top-Of-Stack                     */
00965                           OS_IDLE_PRIO,                              /* Lowest priority level                */
00966                           OS_TASK_IDLE_ID,
00967                           &OSTaskIdleStk[0],                         /* Set Bottom-Of-Stack                  */
00968                           OS_TASK_IDLE_STK_SIZE,
00969                           (void *)0,                                 /* No TCB extension                     */
00970                           OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CHK | OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CLR);/* Enable stack checking + clear stack  */
00971     #else
00972     (void)OSTaskCreateExt(OS_TaskIdle,
00973                           (void *)0,                                 /* No arguments passed to OS_TaskIdle() */
00974                           &OSTaskIdleStk[0],                         /* Set Top-Of-Stack                     */
00975                           OS_IDLE_PRIO,                              /* Lowest priority level                */
00976                           OS_TASK_IDLE_ID,
00977                           &OSTaskIdleStk[OS_TASK_IDLE_STK_SIZE - 1], /* Set Bottom-Of-Stack                  */
00978                           OS_TASK_IDLE_STK_SIZE,
00979                           (void *)0,                                 /* No TCB extension                     */
00980                           OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CHK | OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CLR);/* Enable stack checking + clear stack  */
00981     #endif
00982 #else
00983     #if OS_STK_GROWTH == 1
00984     (void)OSTaskCreate(OS_TaskIdle,
00985                        (void *)0,
00986                        &OSTaskIdleStk[OS_TASK_IDLE_STK_SIZE - 1],
00987                        OS_IDLE_PRIO);
00988     #else
00989     (void)OSTaskCreate(OS_TaskIdle,
00990                        (void *)0,
00991                        &OSTaskIdleStk[0],
00992                        OS_IDLE_PRIO);
00993     #endif
00994 #endif
00995 
00996 #if OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE > 14                    
00997     OSTaskNameSet(OS_IDLE_PRIO, "uC/OS-II Idle", &err);
00998 #endif
00999 }
01000 /*$PAGE*/
01001 /*
01002 *********************************************************************************************************
01003 *                                             INITIALIZATION
01004 *                                      CREATING THE STATISTIC TASK
01005 *
01006 * Description: This function creates the Statistic Task.
01007 *
01008 * Arguments  : none
01009 *
01010 * Returns    : none
01011 *********************************************************************************************************
01012 */
01013 
01014 #if OS_TASK_STAT_EN > 0
01015 static  void  OS_InitTaskStat (void)
01016 {
01017 #if OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE > 14                    
01018     INT8U  err;
01019 #endif
01020 
01021 
01022 #if OS_TASK_CREATE_EXT_EN > 0
01023     #if OS_STK_GROWTH == 1
01024     (void)OSTaskCreateExt(OS_TaskStat,
01025                           (void *)0,                                   /* No args passed to OS_TaskStat()*/
01026                           &OSTaskStatStk[OS_TASK_STAT_STK_SIZE - 1],   /* Set Top-Of-Stack               */
01027                           OS_STAT_PRIO,                                /* One higher than the idle task  */
01028                           OS_TASK_STAT_ID,
01029                           &OSTaskStatStk[0],                           /* Set Bottom-Of-Stack            */
01030                           OS_TASK_STAT_STK_SIZE,
01031                           (void *)0,                                   /* No TCB extension               */
01032                           OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CHK | OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CLR);  /* Enable stack checking + clear  */
01033     #else
01034     (void)OSTaskCreateExt(OS_TaskStat,
01035                           (void *)0,                                   /* No args passed to OS_TaskStat()*/
01036                           &OSTaskStatStk[0],                           /* Set Top-Of-Stack               */
01037                           OS_STAT_PRIO,                                /* One higher than the idle task  */
01038                           OS_TASK_STAT_ID,
01039                           &OSTaskStatStk[OS_TASK_STAT_STK_SIZE - 1],   /* Set Bottom-Of-Stack            */
01040                           OS_TASK_STAT_STK_SIZE,
01041                           (void *)0,                                   /* No TCB extension               */
01042                           OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CHK | OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CLR);  /* Enable stack checking + clear  */
01043     #endif
01044 #else
01045     #if OS_STK_GROWTH == 1
01046     (void)OSTaskCreate(OS_TaskStat,
01047                        (void *)0,                                      /* No args passed to OS_TaskStat()*/
01048                        &OSTaskStatStk[OS_TASK_STAT_STK_SIZE - 1],      /* Set Top-Of-Stack               */
01049                        OS_STAT_PRIO);                                  /* One higher than the idle task  */
01050     #else
01051     (void)OSTaskCreate(OS_TaskStat,
01052                        (void *)0,                                      /* No args passed to OS_TaskStat()*/
01053                        &OSTaskStatStk[0],                              /* Set Top-Of-Stack               */
01054                        OS_STAT_PRIO);                                  /* One higher than the idle task  */
01055     #endif
01056 #endif
01057 
01058 #if OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE > 14
01059     OSTaskNameSet(OS_STAT_PRIO, "uC/OS-II Stat", &err);
01060 #endif
01061 }
01062 #endif
01063 /*$PAGE*/
01064 /*
01065 *********************************************************************************************************
01066 *                                             INITIALIZATION
01067 *                            INITIALIZE THE FREE LIST OF TASK CONTROL BLOCKS
01068 *
01069 * Description: This function is called by OSInit() to initialize the free list of OS_TCBs.
01070 *
01071 * Arguments  : none
01072 *
01073 * Returns    : none
01074 *********************************************************************************************************
01075 */
01076 
01077 static  void  OS_InitTCBList (void)
01078 {
01079     INT8U    i;
01080     OS_TCB  *ptcb1;
01081     OS_TCB  *ptcb2;
01082 
01083 
01084     OS_MemClr((INT8U *)&OSTCBTbl[0],     sizeof(OSTCBTbl));      /* Clear all the TCBs                 */
01085     OS_MemClr((INT8U *)&OSTCBPrioTbl[0], sizeof(OSTCBPrioTbl));  /* Clear the priority table           */
01086     ptcb1 = &OSTCBTbl[0];
01087     ptcb2 = &OSTCBTbl[1];
01088     for (i = 0; i < (OS_MAX_TASKS + OS_N_SYS_TASKS - 1); i++) {  /* Init. list of free TCBs            */
01089         ptcb1->OSTCBNext = ptcb2;
01090 #if OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE > 1
01091         ptcb1->OSTCBTaskName[0] = '?';                           /* Unknown name                       */
01092         ptcb1->OSTCBTaskName[1] = OS_ASCII_NUL;
01093 #endif
01094         ptcb1++;
01095         ptcb2++;
01096     }
01097     ptcb1->OSTCBNext = (OS_TCB *)0;                              /* Last OS_TCB                        */
01098 #if OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE > 1
01099     ptcb1->OSTCBTaskName[0] = '?';                               /* Unknown name                       */
01100     ptcb1->OSTCBTaskName[1] = OS_ASCII_NUL;
01101 #endif
01102     OSTCBList               = (OS_TCB *)0;                       /* TCB lists initializations          */
01103     OSTCBFreeList           = &OSTCBTbl[0];
01104 }
01105 /*$PAGE*/
01106 /*
01107 *********************************************************************************************************
01108 *                                        CLEAR A SECTION OF MEMORY
01109 *
01110 * Description: This function is called by other uC/OS-II services to clear a contiguous block of RAM.
01111 *
01112 * Arguments  : pdest    is the start of the RAM to clear (i.e. write 0x00 to)
01113 *
01114 *              size     is the number of bytes to clear.  
01115 *
01116 * Returns    : none
01117 *
01118 * Notes      : 1) This function is INTERNAL to uC/OS-II and your application should not call it.
01119 *              2) Note that we can only clear up to 64K bytes of RAM.  This is not an issue because none 
01120 *                 of the uses of this function gets close to this limit.
01121 *              3) The clear is done one byte at a time since this will work on any processor irrespective
01122 *                 of the alignment of the destination.
01123 *********************************************************************************************************
01124 */
01125 
01126 void  OS_MemClr (INT8U *pdest, INT16U size)
01127 {
01128     while (size > 0) {
01129         *pdest++ = (INT8U)0;
01130         size--;
01131     }
01132 }
01133 /*$PAGE*/
01134 /*
01135 *********************************************************************************************************
01136 *                                        COPY A BLOCK OF MEMORY
01137 *
01138 * Description: This function is called by other uC/OS-II services to copy a block of memory from one 
01139 *              location to another.
01140 *
01141 * Arguments  : pdest    is a pointer to the 'destination' memory block
01142 *
01143 *              psrc     is a pointer to the 'source'      memory block
01144 *
01145 *              size     is the number of bytes to copy.  
01146 *
01147 * Returns    : none
01148 *
01149 * Notes      : 1) This function is INTERNAL to uC/OS-II and your application should not call it.  There is 
01150 *                 no provision to handle overlapping memory copy.  However, that's not a problem since this
01151 *                 is not a situation that will happen.
01152 *              2) Note that we can only copy up to 64K bytes of RAM
01153 *              3) The copy is done one byte at a time since this will work on any processor irrespective
01154 *                 of the alignment of the source and destination.
01155 *********************************************************************************************************
01156 */
01157 
01158 void  OS_MemCopy (INT8U *pdest, INT8U *psrc, INT16U size)
01159 {
01160     while (size > 0) {
01161         *pdest++ = *psrc++;
01162         size--;
01163     }
01164 }
01165 /*$PAGE*/
01166 /*
01167 *********************************************************************************************************
01168 *                                              SCHEDULER
01169 *
01170 * Description: This function is called by other uC/OS-II services to determine whether a new, high
01171 *              priority task has been made ready to run.  This function is invoked by TASK level code
01172 *              and is not used to reschedule tasks from ISRs (see OSIntExit() for ISR rescheduling).
01173 *
01174 * Arguments  : none
01175 *
01176 * Returns    : none
01177 *
01178 * Notes      : 1) This function is INTERNAL to uC/OS-II and your application should not call it.
01179 *              2) Rescheduling is prevented when the scheduler is locked (see OS_SchedLock())
01180 *********************************************************************************************************
01181 */
01182 
01183 void  OS_Sched (void)
01184 {
01185     INT8U      y;
01186 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                            /* Allocate storage for CPU status register     */
01187     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
01188 #endif    
01189 
01190 
01191 
01192     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
01193     if (OSIntNesting == 0) {                           /* Schedule only if all ISRs done and ...       */
01194         if (OSLockNesting == 0) {                      /* ... scheduler is not locked                  */
01195             y             = OSUnMapTbl[OSRdyGrp];      /* Get pointer to HPT ready to run              */
01196             OSPrioHighRdy = (INT8U)((y << 3) + OSUnMapTbl[OSRdyTbl[y]]);
01197             if (OSPrioHighRdy != OSPrioCur) {          /* No Ctx Sw if current task is highest rdy     */
01198                 OSTCBHighRdy = OSTCBPrioTbl[OSPrioHighRdy];
01199 #if OS_TASK_PROFILE_EN > 0
01200                 OSTCBHighRdy->OSTCBCtxSwCtr++;         /* Inc. # of context switches to this task      */
01201 #endif
01202                 OSCtxSwCtr++;                          /* Increment context switch counter             */
01203                 OS_TASK_SW();                          /* Perform a context switch                     */
01204             }
01205         }
01206     }
01207     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
01208 }
01209 /*$PAGE*/
01210 /*
01211 *********************************************************************************************************
01212 *                                        COPY AN ASCII STRING
01213 *
01214 * Description: This function is called by other uC/OS-II services to copy an ASCII string from a 'source'
01215 *              string to a 'destination' string.
01216 *
01217 * Arguments  : pdest    is a pointer to the string that will be receiving the copy.  Note that there MUST
01218 *                       be sufficient space in the destination storage area to receive this string.
01219 *
01220 *              psrc     is a pointer to the source string.  The source string MUST NOT be greater than 
01221 *                       254 characters.
01222 *
01223 * Returns    : The size of the string (excluding the NUL terminating character)
01224 *
01225 * Notes      : 1) This function is INTERNAL to uC/OS-II and your application should not call it.
01226 *********************************************************************************************************
01227 */
01228 
01229 #if (OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE > 1) || (OS_FLAG_NAME_SIZE > 1) || (OS_MEM_NAME_SIZE > 1) || (OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE > 1)
01230 INT8U  OS_StrCopy (char *pdest, char *psrc)
01231 {
01232     INT8U  len;
01233 
01234 
01235     len = 0;
01236     while (*psrc != OS_ASCII_NUL) {
01237         *pdest++ = *psrc++;
01238         len++;
01239     }
01240     *pdest = OS_ASCII_NUL;
01241     return (len);
01242 }
01243 #endif
01244 /*$PAGE*/
01245 /*
01246 *********************************************************************************************************
01247 *                                DETERMINE THE LENGTH OF AN ASCII STRING
01248 *
01249 * Description: This function is called by other uC/OS-II services to determine the size of an ASCII string
01250 *              (excluding the NUL character).
01251 *
01252 * Arguments  : psrc     is a pointer to the string for which we need to know the size.
01253 *
01254 * Returns    : The size of the string (excluding the NUL terminating character)
01255 *
01256 * Notes      : 1) This function is INTERNAL to uC/OS-II and your application should not call it.
01257 *              2) The string to check must be less than 255 characters long.
01258 *********************************************************************************************************
01259 */
01260 
01261 #if (OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE > 1) || (OS_FLAG_NAME_SIZE > 1) || (OS_MEM_NAME_SIZE > 1) || (OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE > 1)
01262 INT8U  OS_StrLen (char *psrc)
01263 {
01264     INT8U  len;
01265 
01266 
01267     len = 0;
01268     while (*psrc != OS_ASCII_NUL) {
01269         psrc++;
01270         len++;
01271     }
01272     return (len);
01273 }
01274 #endif
01275 /*$PAGE*/
01276 /*
01277 *********************************************************************************************************
01278 *                                              IDLE TASK
01279 *
01280 * Description: This task is internal to uC/OS-II and executes whenever no other higher priority tasks
01281 *              executes because they are ALL waiting for event(s) to occur.
01282 *
01283 * Arguments  : none
01284 *
01285 * Returns    : none
01286 *
01287 * Note(s)    : 1) OSTaskIdleHook() is called after the critical section to ensure that interrupts will be
01288 *                 enabled for at least a few instructions.  On some processors (ex. Philips XA), enabling
01289 *                 and then disabling interrupts didn't allow the processor enough time to have interrupts
01290 *                 enabled before they were disabled again.  uC/OS-II would thus never recognize
01291 *                 interrupts.
01292 *              2) This hook has been added to allow you to do such things as STOP the CPU to conserve 
01293 *                 power.
01294 *********************************************************************************************************
01295 */
01296 
01297 void  OS_TaskIdle (void *parg)
01298 {
01299 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
01300     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
01301 #endif    
01302 
01303 
01304 
01305     (void)parg;                                  /* Prevent compiler warning for not using 'parg'      */
01306     for (;;) {
01307         OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
01308         OSIdleCtr++;
01309         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
01310         OSTaskIdleHook();                        /* Call user definable HOOK                           */
01311     }
01312 }
01313 /*$PAGE*/
01314 /*
01315 *********************************************************************************************************
01316 *                                            STATISTICS TASK
01317 *
01318 * Description: This task is internal to uC/OS-II and is used to compute some statistics about the
01319 *              multitasking environment.  Specifically, OS_TaskStat() computes the CPU usage.
01320 *              CPU usage is determined by:
01321 *
01322 *                                          OSIdleCtr
01323 *                 OSCPUUsage = 100 * (1 - ------------)     (units are in %)
01324 *                                         OSIdleCtrMax
01325 *
01326 * Arguments  : parg     this pointer is not used at this time.
01327 *
01328 * Returns    : none
01329 *
01330 * Notes      : 1) This task runs at a priority level higher than the idle task.  In fact, it runs at the
01331 *                 next higher priority, OS_IDLE_PRIO-1.
01332 *              2) You can disable this task by setting the configuration #define OS_TASK_STAT_EN to 0.
01333 *              3) You MUST have at least a delay of 2/10 seconds to allow for the system to establish the 
01334 *                 maximum value for the idle counter.
01335 *********************************************************************************************************
01336 */
01337 
01338 #if OS_TASK_STAT_EN > 0
01339 void  OS_TaskStat (void *parg)
01340 {
01341     INT32U     run;
01342     INT32U     max;
01343     INT8S      usage;
01344 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
01345     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
01346 #endif    
01347 
01348 
01349 
01350     (void)parg;                                  /* Prevent compiler warning for not using 'parg'      */
01351     while (OSStatRdy == FALSE) {
01352         OSTimeDly(2 * OS_TICKS_PER_SEC / 10);    /* Wait until statistic task is ready                 */
01353     }
01354     max = OSIdleCtrMax / 100L;
01355     for (;;) {
01356         OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
01357         OSIdleCtrRun = OSIdleCtr;                /* Obtain the of the idle counter for the past second */
01358         run          = OSIdleCtr;
01359         OSIdleCtr    = 0L;                       /* Reset the idle counter for the next second         */
01360         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
01361         if (max > 0L) {
01362             usage = (INT8S)(100L - run / max);
01363             if (usage >= 0) {                    /* Make sure we don't have a negative percentage      */
01364                 OSCPUUsage = usage;
01365             } else {
01366                 OSCPUUsage = 0;
01367             }
01368         } else {
01369             OSCPUUsage = 0;
01370             max        = OSIdleCtrMax / 100L;
01371         }
01372         OSTaskStatHook();                        /* Invoke user definable hook                         */
01373 #if (OS_TASK_STAT_STK_CHK_EN > 0) && (OS_TASK_CREATE_EXT_EN > 0)
01374         OS_TaskStatStkChk();                     /* Check the stacks for each task                     */
01375 #endif
01376         OSTimeDly(OS_TICKS_PER_SEC / 10);        /* Accumulate OSIdleCtr for the next 1/10 second      */
01377     }
01378 }
01379 #endif
01380 /*$PAGE*/
01381 /*
01382 *********************************************************************************************************
01383 *                                      CHECK ALL TASK STACKS
01384 *
01385 * Description: This function is called by OS_TaskStat() to check the stacks of each active task.
01386 *
01387 * Arguments  : none
01388 *
01389 * Returns    : none
01390 *********************************************************************************************************
01391 */
01392 
01393 #if (OS_TASK_STAT_STK_CHK_EN > 0) && (OS_TASK_CREATE_EXT_EN > 0)
01394 void  OS_TaskStatStkChk (void)
01395 {
01396     OS_TCB      *ptcb;
01397     OS_STK_DATA  stk_data;
01398     INT8U        err;
01399     INT8U        prio;
01400 
01401 
01402     for (prio = 0; prio <= OS_IDLE_PRIO; prio++) {
01403         err = OSTaskStkChk(prio, &stk_data);
01404         if (err == OS_NO_ERR) {
01405             ptcb = OSTCBPrioTbl[prio];
01406             if (ptcb != (OS_TCB *)0) {                               /* Make sure task 'ptcb' is ...   */
01407                 if (ptcb != (OS_TCB *)1) {                           /* ... still valid.               */
01408 #if OS_TASK_PROFILE_EN > 0
01409                     #if OS_STK_GROWTH == 1
01410                     ptcb->OSTCBStkBase = ptcb->OSTCBStkBottom + ptcb->OSTCBStkSize;
01411                     #else
01412                     ptcb->OSTCBStkBase = ptcb->OSTCBStkBottom - ptcb->OSTCBStkSize;
01413                     #endif
01414                     ptcb->OSTCBStkUsed = (INT32U)stk_data.OSUsed;    /* Store the number of bytes used */
01415 #endif
01416                 }
01417             }
01418         }
01419     }
01420 }
01421 #endif
01422 /*$PAGE*/
01423 /*
01424 *********************************************************************************************************
01425 *                                            INITIALIZE TCB
01426 *
01427 * Description: This function is internal to uC/OS-II and is used to initialize a Task Control Block when
01428 *              a task is created (see OSTaskCreate() and OSTaskCreateExt()).
01429 *
01430 * Arguments  : prio          is the priority of the task being created
01431 *
01432 *              ptos          is a pointer to the task's top-of-stack assuming that the CPU registers
01433 *                            have been placed on the stack.  Note that the top-of-stack corresponds to a
01434 *                            'high' memory location is OS_STK_GROWTH is set to 1 and a 'low' memory
01435 *                            location if OS_STK_GROWTH is set to 0.  Note that stack growth is CPU
01436 *                            specific.
01437 *
01438 *              pbos          is a pointer to the bottom of stack.  A NULL pointer is passed if called by
01439 *                            'OSTaskCreate()'.
01440 *
01441 *              id            is the task's ID (0..65535)
01442 *
01443 *              stk_size      is the size of the stack (in 'stack units').  If the stack units are INT8Us
01444 *                            then, 'stk_size' contains the number of bytes for the stack.  If the stack
01445 *                            units are INT32Us then, the stack contains '4 * stk_size' bytes.  The stack
01446 *                            units are established by the #define constant OS_STK which is CPU
01447 *                            specific.  'stk_size' is 0 if called by 'OSTaskCreate()'.
01448 *
01449 *              pext          is a pointer to a user supplied memory area that is used to extend the task
01450 *                            control block.  This allows you to store the contents of floating-point
01451 *                            registers, MMU registers or anything else you could find useful during a
01452 *                            context switch.  You can even assign a name to each task and store this name
01453 *                            in this TCB extension.  A NULL pointer is passed if called by OSTaskCreate().
01454 *
01455 *              opt           options as passed to 'OSTaskCreateExt()' or,
01456 *                            0 if called from 'OSTaskCreate()'.
01457 *
01458 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR         if the call was successful
01459 *              OS_NO_MORE_TCB    if there are no more free TCBs to be allocated and thus, the task cannot
01460 *                                be created.
01461 *
01462 * Note       : This function is INTERNAL to uC/OS-II and your application should not call it.
01463 *********************************************************************************************************
01464 */
01465 
01466 INT8U  OS_TCBInit (INT8U prio, OS_STK *ptos, OS_STK *pbos, INT16U id, INT32U stk_size, void *pext, INT16U opt)
01467 {
01468     OS_TCB    *ptcb;
01469 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                                /* Allocate storage for CPU status register */
01470     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
01471 #endif    
01472 
01473 
01474 
01475     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
01476     ptcb = OSTCBFreeList;                                  /* Get a free TCB from the free TCB list    */
01477     if (ptcb != (OS_TCB *)0) {
01478         OSTCBFreeList        = ptcb->OSTCBNext;            /* Update pointer to free TCB list          */
01479         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
01480         ptcb->OSTCBStkPtr    = ptos;                       /* Load Stack pointer in TCB                */
01481         ptcb->OSTCBPrio      = prio;                       /* Load task priority into TCB              */
01482         ptcb->OSTCBStat      = OS_STAT_RDY;                /* Task is ready to run                     */
01483         ptcb->OSTCBPendTO    = FALSE;                      /* Clear the Pend timeout flag              */
01484         ptcb->OSTCBDly       = 0;                          /* Task is not delayed                      */
01485 
01486 #if OS_TASK_CREATE_EXT_EN > 0
01487         ptcb->OSTCBExtPtr    = pext;                       /* Store pointer to TCB extension           */
01488         ptcb->OSTCBStkSize   = stk_size;                   /* Store stack size                         */
01489         ptcb->OSTCBStkBottom = pbos;                       /* Store pointer to bottom of stack         */
01490         ptcb->OSTCBOpt       = opt;                        /* Store task options                       */
01491         ptcb->OSTCBId        = id;                         /* Store task ID                            */
01492 #else
01493         pext                 = pext;                       /* Prevent compiler warning if not used     */
01494         stk_size             = stk_size;
01495         pbos                 = pbos;
01496         opt                  = opt;
01497         id                   = id;
01498 #endif
01499 
01500 #if OS_TASK_DEL_EN > 0
01501         ptcb->OSTCBDelReq    = OS_NO_ERR;
01502 #endif
01503 
01504         ptcb->OSTCBY         = (INT8U)(prio >> 3);         /* Pre-compute X, Y, BitX and BitY          */
01505         ptcb->OSTCBBitY      = OSMapTbl[ptcb->OSTCBY];
01506         ptcb->OSTCBX         = (INT8U)(prio & 0x07);
01507         ptcb->OSTCBBitX      = OSMapTbl[ptcb->OSTCBX];
01508 
01509 #if OS_EVENT_EN
01510         ptcb->OSTCBEventPtr  = (OS_EVENT *)0;              /* Task is not pending on an event          */
01511 #endif
01512 
01513 #if (OS_VERSION >= 251) && (OS_FLAG_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_FLAGS > 0) && (OS_TASK_DEL_EN > 0)
01514         ptcb->OSTCBFlagNode  = (OS_FLAG_NODE *)0;          /* Task is not pending on an event flag     */
01515 #endif
01516 
01517 #if (OS_MBOX_EN > 0) || ((OS_Q_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_QS > 0))
01518         ptcb->OSTCBMsg       = (void *)0;                  /* No message received                      */
01519 #endif
01520 
01521 #if OS_TASK_PROFILE_EN > 0
01522         ptcb->OSTCBCtxSwCtr    = 0L;                       /* Initialize profiling variables           */
01523         ptcb->OSTCBCyclesStart = 0L;
01524         ptcb->OSTCBCyclesTot   = 0L;
01525         ptcb->OSTCBStkBase     = (OS_STK *)0;
01526         ptcb->OSTCBStkUsed     = 0L;
01527 #endif
01528 
01529 #if OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE > 1
01530         ptcb->OSTCBTaskName[0] = '?';                      /* Unknown name at task creation            */
01531         ptcb->OSTCBTaskName[1] = OS_ASCII_NUL;
01532 #endif
01533 
01534 #if OS_VERSION >= 204
01535         OSTCBInitHook(ptcb);
01536 #endif
01537 
01538         OSTaskCreateHook(ptcb);                            /* Call user defined hook                   */
01539         
01540         OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
01541         OSTCBPrioTbl[prio] = ptcb;
01542         ptcb->OSTCBNext    = OSTCBList;                    /* Link into TCB chain                      */
01543         ptcb->OSTCBPrev    = (OS_TCB *)0;
01544         if (OSTCBList != (OS_TCB *)0) {
01545             OSTCBList->OSTCBPrev = ptcb;
01546         }
01547         OSTCBList               = ptcb;
01548         OSRdyGrp               |= ptcb->OSTCBBitY;         /* Make task ready to run                   */
01549         OSRdyTbl[ptcb->OSTCBY] |= ptcb->OSTCBBitX;
01550         OSTaskCtr++;                                       /* Increment the #tasks counter             */
01551         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
01552         return (OS_NO_ERR);
01553     }
01554     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
01555     return (OS_NO_MORE_TCB);
01556 }
